question: If I find wetness in my dress after sleep how to distinguish as mani or mazi.Please explain

ANSWER

Hadhrat Aaisha (Radhiallaahu Anha) narrates that Rasulullah (Sallallaahu%0D%0AAlayhi Wasallam) was asked about a person who finds wetness upon waking up%0D%0Aand he does not remember seeing a dream. Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi%0D%0AWasallam) said, 'He should make Ghusl.' Rasulullah (Sallallaahu Alayhi%0D%0AWasallam) was also asked about a person who remembers seeing a dream and%0D%0Adoes not see wetness, he replied, 'There is no Ghusl upon the person.'%0D%0A%0D%0AUmm Sulaym (Radhiallaahu Anhu) said, 'Is there Ghusl upon a woman when she%0D%0Aexperiences the same?' (as the man). Rasulullah said, 'Yes, a female is%0D%0Asimilar to a male.'%0D%0A%0D%0AFrom this, fourteen possible situations could arise:%0D%0A%0D%0AHe Remembers having a Dream and is certain that:%0D%0A1. The Wetness is Mani (sperm)%0D%0A2. The wetness is Mazi (spermlike secreted fluid during excitement)%0D%0A3. The wetness if Wadi (spermlike fluid, generally secreted after%0D%0Aurination).%0D%0A%0D%0AHe Does not Remember Having a Dream and he is certain that:%0D%0A4. The Wetness is Mani (sperm)%0D%0A5. The wetness is Mazi (spermlike secreted fluid during excitement)%0D%0A6. The wetness if Wadi (spermlike fluid, generally secreted after%0D%0Aurination).%0D%0A%0D%0AHe Remembers Having a Dream but is doubtful%0D%0A7. in the wetness being Mani or Mazi%0D%0A8. in the wetness being Mani or Wadi%0D%0A9. in the wetness being Mazi or Wadi%0D%0A10. in the wetness being Mani, Mazi or Wadi%0D%0A%0D%0AHe Does not Remember Having a Dream and has a doubt%0D%0A11. in the wetness being Mani or Mazi%0D%0A12. in the wetness being Mani or Wadi%0D%0A13. in the wetness being Mazi or Wadi%0D%0A14. in the wetness being Mani, Mazi or Wadi%0D%0A%0D%0AThere is no Ghusl in 3, 5, 6 and 13. There is Ghusl in the other 10%0D%0Asituations.%0D%0A%0D%0Aand Allah Ta'ala Knows Best%0D%0A%0D%0AMufti Ebrahim Desai%0D%0AFATWA DEPT.%0D%0A
